<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="block">
            <l>With that a joyous fellowship issued</l>
            <l>Of misntrels making goodly merriment</l>
            <l>With wanton bardes and Rhymers 
              <choice>
                <sic>im⅜udent</sic>
                <corr>impudent</corr>
              </choice></l>
          </quote>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">--that voice reached Spenser too in the great room.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">If the great 
            <choice>
              <sic>Elizabetahn</sic>
              <corr>Elizabethan</corr>
            </choice> house, <add hand="ms">(</add><rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-pens" key="Penshurst">Penshurst</rs>, Wilton as we see it</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">now cluttered with villas and bungalows, looks out</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of proportion, it is 
            <choice>
              <sic>beacuse</sic>
              <corr>because</corr>
            </choice> the connection between the great house</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and the small is lost. If we could see it as it was in Spensers</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">time we should see rxmxmxmxmxmxmxxx tracks, raying out from the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">great gate to the across the fields to the 
            <choice>
              <sic>cooatge</sic>
              <corr>cottage</corr>
            </choice>, to</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the farms, even to the hovels. <add hand="ms" place="above">there was the</add> It was connected, if war <del hand="ms">came</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">by the <del hand="ms">need of men</del>. There was armour stored in the church. <del hand="ms">And</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><add hand="ms">???</add>the perpetual fight with nature <del hand="ms">made tracks from the house to the</del></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del hand="ms">farm.</del> A common fight linked the noble to the 
            <choice>
              <sic>labourrer</sic>
              <corr>labourer</corr>
            </choice>.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">That connection, the physical, between master and man</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">is painfully and 
            <choice>
              <sic>minitelt</sic>
              <corr>minutely</corr>
            </choice> recorded in the medieval letters.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It is the staple of the whole 
            <choice>
              <sic>correspon nce</sic>
              <corr>correspondence</corr>
            </choice>--the   But there was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">also the other the less visible connection--the common belief.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">That bond between the 
            <choice>
              <sic>grear</sic>
              <corr>great</corr>
            </choice> house and the small has been</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">grown over, like the 
            <choice>
              <sic>t ack</sic>
              <corr>track</corr>
            </choice> under the hill along whch the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">pilgrims rode to Canterbury. No one drives 
            <choice>
              <sic>the e</sic>
              <corr>there</corr>
            </choice> now. But when</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Spenser came to Penshurst that 
            <choice>
              <sic>rack</sic>
              <corr>track</corr>
            </choice> led from one house to another;</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">pilgrims rode to Canterbury. No one drives 
            <choice>
              <sic>the e</sic>
              <corr>there</corr>
            </choice> now. But when</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Spenser came to Penshurst that 
            <choice>
              <sic>rack</sic>
              <corr>track</corr>
            </choice> led from one house to another;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It led to the village green. It led to the tree<add hand="ms" place="inline">:</add> to the well.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">In the spring they danced round the Maypole; at midsummer they</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">lit the bon fire on the hill; at harvest the waggons were 
            <choice>
              <sic>crwoned</sic>
              <corr>crowned</corr>
            </choice>.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">At Christmas the mummers acted their dumb show; the boys 
            <choice>
              <sic>scame</sic>
              <corr>came</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">wassailing. The roads led to the <del hand="ms">pagan graces,</del> to the stones</l>
